channel.title: Aws,cloudfront,lambda,lambda@edge,s3 on Martin Costello's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Aws,cloudfront,lambda,lambda@edge,s3 on Martin Costello's Blog

item.title: Migrating to Amazon S3
item.description: Since I set up my blog in March 2014, it’s been running in IIS as part of an Azure App Service. Initially this was required as the blog was originally a WordPress site, so a server was required to run the PHP code for WordPress. However when I got fed up with keeping WordPress up-to-date and migrated to a static Middleman site, I left it hosted in Azure. This was mainly because it was the easiest option, as that’s where it was already, but also because this allowed me to specify HTTP response headers still, such as for X-Frame-Options.
